DOC.brief_summary: Lens Fitting Evaluation CooperVision MyDay™ Compared 1-DAY ACUVUE® TruEye® DAILIES TOTAL1®
DOC.brief_title: Lens Fitting Evaluation CooperVision MyDay™ Compared With 1-DAY ACUVUE® TruEye® DAILIES TOTAL1®
DOC.detailed_description: The aim non-dispensing study evaluate fitting performance MyDay™ 8.4 base curve , especially flat cornea , compare 1-DAY ACUVUE® TruEye® 9.0 base curve DAILIES TOTAL1® 8.8 base curve range spherical power .
DOC.criteria: Is 18 40 year age ( inclusive ) Has selfreported visual exam last two year Is adapt soft spherical contact lens wearer Has contact lens spherical prescription 4.00 6.00 high 7.00D ( Diopters ) ( inclusive ) Has BFS ( Best Fit Sphere ) high 8.2 measure calculated corneal topography Can achieve best correct spectacle distance visual acuity 20/25 ( 0.10 logMAR ) good eye Can achieve distance visual acuity 20/30 ( 0.18 logMAR ) good eye study contact lenses Has clear cornea active ocular disease Has read , understood sign information consent letter Patient contact lens refraction fit within available parameter study lens Is willing comply wear schedule Is willing comply visit schedule Is habitual wearer soft spherical contact lenses Has contact lens prescription outside range available parameter study lenses Has contact lens prescription outside range inclusion power range Has spectacle cylinder ≥1.00D cylinder either eye Has history achieve comfortable contact lens wear ( 5 day per week ; > 8 hours/day ) Has contact lens best correct distance vision bad 20/25 ( 0.10 logMAR ) either eye Presence clinically significant ( grade > 2 ) anterior segment abnormality Presence ocular systemic disease need medication might interfere contact lens wear Slit lamp finding would contraindicate contact lens wear : Moderate severe dry eye Pterygium , pinguecula , corneal scar within visual axis Neovascularization > 0.75 mm limbus Giant papillary conjunctivitis ( GCP ) bad grade 1 Anterior uveitis iritis ( past present ) Seborrheic eczema , Seborrheic conjunctivitis History corneal ulcer fungal infection Poor personal hygiene Has know history corneal hypoesthesia ( reduced corneal sensitivity ) Has aphakia , keratoconus highly irregular cornea Has Presbyopia dependence spectacle near work contact lenses Has undergone corneal refractive surgery Is participate type eye related clinical research study
